oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DEVELOPMENT OF TWO-DIMENSIONAL NUMERICAL WAVE FLUME FOR WAVE INTERACTION WITH RUBBLE MOUND BREAKWATERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Troch, Peter
De Rouck, Julien
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: numerical wave
flume
breakwater
rubble mound breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The numerical wave flume VOFbreak2 for simulation of wave interaction with a rubble mound breakwater is presented. The key innovations are a porous flow model and wave boundary conditions. The porous flow is implemented using a Forchheimer model. At the boundaries waves are generated using a combined wave generation-absorption technique and are absorped using a numerical sponge layer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
